newsitem.title: USA: Wall Street still sharply off, calmer tone sets in.
newsitem.headline: Wall Street still sharply off, calmer tone sets in.

text.p: A calmer tone washed over Wall Street stocks late Friday morning as the Dow Industrials shed some of their earlier losses.

The market was trading sideways as it took stock of the latest rout, which was blamed on a sliding dollar, weaker bonds and questions about blue chip earnings after Gillette Co's earnings forecast was cut by analysts.
The Dow was off 79.21 points, or one percent, at 7862.82, well off the day's low of 7818.46. The long bond also pared earlier losses and was down 13/32 to yield 6.58 percent.
